channel.title: RuneSource RSA
channel.description: [code]Accepted Client(127.0.0.1). Unable to decode RSA block properly! Client(127.0.0.1) disconnecting. Client(127.0.0.1) has logged out. java.lang.NullPointerException at java.io.DataOutputStream.writeUTF(DataOutputStream.java:347) at java.io.DataOutputStream.writeUTF(DataOutputStream.java:323) at com.rs2.util.PlayerSave.save(PlayerSave.java:57) at com.rs2.model.players.Player.logout(Player.java:551) at com.rs2.model.players.Player.disconnect(Player.java:344) at com.rs2.net.Login.handleLogin(Login.java:88) at com.rs2.net.packet.PacketManager.handleIncomingData(PacketManager.jav a:125) at com.rs2.Server.cycle(Server.java:193) at com.rs2.Server.run(Server.java:116) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722) [/code]

item.title: RuneSource RSA
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“final9999, post:5, topic:465618”][SOLVED]
Disabling RSA server sided worked perfectly. Eventually I have to look into RSA to prevent sniffing data tough.

Thanks for the help.[/quote]Don’t bother.

item.title: RuneSource RSA
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“final9999, post:3, topic:465618”]I’m having the exact same problem as the original poster. Didn’t wanted to make a re-post so just hope anybody got a solution for me. (I’m using Asteria 2.0)

Client’s I’ve tryed:

  • 2006Memorys Client;
  • Galkon’s Refactored[474-look-alike]
  • rs317;
  • srcAllDummysRemoved.

I have no idea, if I’m using a wrong client aswell or it’s caused by another bug.

Hope some1 can help.

Regards,

Blaze[/quote]
you have to disable RSA in the login block server sided.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneSource RSA
item.dc:creator: @final9999 final9999
item.description:
@final9999 wrote:

I’m having the exact same problem as the original poster. Didn’t wanted to make a re-post so just hope anybody got a solution for me. (I’m using Asteria 2.0)

Client’s I’ve tryed:

  • 2006Memorys Client;
  • Galkon’s Refactored[474-look-alike]
  • rs317;
  • srcAllDummysRemoved.

I have no idea, if I’m using a wrong client aswell or it’s caused by another bug.

Hope some1 can help.

Regards,

Blaze

What client are you using? Make sure you are using a 317 deob.
